# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is a Julia function that accomplishes this task:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```

This function works by first converting the column name to lower case, then stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces. It uses a regular expression (`r"[\s-]+"`) to replace all spaces and hyphens with an underscore. The `replace` function does this replacement in the string.
